titles.title: Jesus, Thy head, once crown’d with thorns

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Jesus, Thy head, once crown’d with thorns, Is crown’d with glory now; Heaven’s royal diadem adorns The mighty Victor’s brow.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Thou glorious light of courts above, Joy of the saints below, To us still manifest Thy love, That we its depths may know.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: To us Thy cross with all its shame, With all its grace be giv’n; Though earth disowns Thy lowly name, God honors it in heav’n.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Who suffer with Thee, Lord, today, Shall also with Thee reign: Then let it be our joy to pay The Price, this goal attain.

verse.name: v5
